symbols.name: sap.ui.dt.designtime.DesignTimeMetadata
symbols.description: Object containing a sample design time configuration

properties.name: name

singular.name: singular
singular.description: i18n key from library's design-time resource bundle or function returning the translated text

plural.name: plural
plural.description: i18n key from library's design-time resource bundle or function returning the translated text

properties.description: Specify or calculate a speaking name for the control (which is understandable to key users). This is needed for the "reveal" action to show the names in the context menu (Add <name in singular> and Available <name in plural>). Name your control based on the general UI concept and follow the guidance from https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design/. Example: Key users don't care about the difference between a smart, mobile or responsive version of a form, it's just a form.

properties.name: getLabel
properties.description: Allows to provide a customized getter for the control label that is used in outlines, context menus and actions like "reveal" or "rename". The default implementation tries to get the following properties in that order: text, labelText, label, title, heading, dataSourceLabel

properties.name: domRef
properties.description: Defines the DOM reference of the control

properties.name: isVisible
properties.description: Needed for Elements that are not derived from sap.ui.core.Control. The function should return the visibility of the Element as a boolean (true = visible). This function can be called before the DOM is ready.

properties.name: palette

icon.name: icon
icon.description: Preferable as SVG as this icon scales

properties.description: Palette settings for the control.

properties.name: templates
properties.description: Create template will not be inherited, they are special to the current type.

properties.name: actions
properties.description: RTA specific actions that can be performed on the control.

properties.name: properties
properties.description: Configuration for the properties of the control. See sap.ui.dt.DesignTimeMetadata.Property

properties.name: aggregations
properties.description: Configuration for the aggregations of the control. See sap.ui.dt.DesignTimeMetadata.Aggregation

properties.name: associations
properties.description: Describes the associations of the control. Per default no association is followed as overlays should match the control hierarchy. No actions are supported for associations. See sap.ui.dt.DesignTimeMetadata.Association

properties.name: annotations
properties.description: Describes the OData annotations that are actively used by your control. This section needs to be filled for controls evaluating annotations. It can be used for documentation purposes, but is also evaluated by UI adaptation at design time.

properties.name: scrollContainers

domRef.name: domRef
domRef.description: Defines the DOM reference for the scroll wrapper

aggregations.name: aggregations
aggregations.description: Names of the aggregations inside the scroll wrapper. Two arguments are passed to the function: the control instance and an update function that can be called if the aggregations change.

properties.description: Describes the scroll containers of the control. This is needed when there are more than one aggregation in one scroll container (e.g. ObjectPageLayout: Header + Sections).

properties.name: tool

start.name: start
start.description: Called when the tool is started

stop.name: stop
stop.description: Called when the tool is stopped

properties.description: This object defines hooks that are being called when a tool, e.g. Runtime Adaptation, is started and stopped. The functions are being called with the control instance as parameter.

properties.name: ignore
properties.description: Used to ignore the aggregation (and all its children) at design time. For example, this can be used to ignore deprecated or duplicated aggregations as well as aggregations irrelevant during the design time (such as dependents). If the value is true, then no overlays will be created for the aggregation and its children. For more options on how to disable actions in design time please refer to the UI5 Demo Kit.

properties.name: domRef
properties.description: Defines the DOM reference of the aggregation. The DOM reference is used to calculate the dimension of the aggregation at design time. This is needed, for instance, to make drag&drop possible. If no domRef property is given, a heuristic is used to calculate the dimension of the aggregation from its children during the design time.

properties.name: childNames

singular.name: singular
singular.description: i18n key from library's design-time resource bundle or function returning the translated text

plural.name: plural
plural.description: i18n key from library's design-time resource bundle or function returning the translated text

properties.description: Provide or compute name for the controls inside the aggregation which is understandable for the key user. This is needed for the "addODataProperty" and "createContainer" action to show the names in the context menu (Add <singular>, Available <plural>). Name the control based on the general UI concept and follow the guidance from https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design/. The key user doesn't care about the difference between a smart, mobile, or responsive version of a form, it's just a form.

properties.name: actions
properties.description: Actions that can be performed on the aggregation (e.g. move).

properties.name: propagateMetadata
properties.description: Returns DesignTime-Metadata object which extends or overrides existing metadata of a successor control. In the negative case it returns the boolean "false" value. The propagateMetadata function gets 2 parameters passed through during execution: oControl and oRelevantContainerControl. The second parameter is the control which has defined this propagation function. It can be used if you need to know the relevantContainer during the execution of the function.

properties.name: propagateRelevantContainer
properties.description: Defines the relevant container control for the actions which belong to successor controls.

properties.name: aggregationLike
properties.description: Can be used to tell the design time that it should follow the association hierarchy. This is used by controls like e.g. the componentContainer that should allow to follow the association component, which defines the control hierarchy but is not a real aggregation (more isolation, regarding model propagation/rendering/eventing/...).

properties.name: ignore
properties.description: Used to ignore the property at design time. For example, this can be used to ignore deprecated properties or properties that shall not be changed during design time.
